content: It appears that search isn't matching on the github repository names in #committers/notification. If I try to search for "US-Core", it only finds the locations where that term is used in the commit message, not in the repository name. Is this a general behavior of not searching hyperlink text, or something special with the FHIR Bot?

I believe it's a general issue with searching hyperlink text, but I'm not sure without investigating more, and it could instead be a pre/post linkifier processing thing. We've been meaning to extent the postgres full-text search to add additional items to the words it finds in a given message from extracting content of links.
Thanks. Do you want me to file an issue?
@Elliot Silver yeah, that'd be helpful; just be specific with precise strings that can reproduce the issue, since that sort of detail can matter.

@Tim Abbott I just filed an issue, and a little investigation shows that the issue is more nuanced than I thought. I've tried to give several examples. (Hehe, as a test, see what a search for "issue" turns up here. Does it get the first issue in this message or this second.issue?)
